description: Goldbach conjecture: a(n) = number of decompositions of 2n into sum of two primes (counting 1 as a prime).

formula: Not very efficient: a(n) = (Sum_{i=1..n} (pi(i) - pi(i-1))*(pi(2*n-i) - pi(2*n-i-1))) + (pi(2*n-1) - pi(2*n-2)) + floor(1/n). - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Jan 06 2013
example: 1 is counted as a prime, so a(1)=1 since 2=1+1, a(2)=2 since 4=2+2=3+1, ..
